meta.content: Official Singles Chart on 25/12/2015 | Official Charts

content.title: Official Singles Chart on 25/12/2015
content.description: The Official UK Singles Chart reflects the UK’s biggest songs of the week, based on audio and video streams, downloads, CDs and vinyl, compiled by the Official Charts Company. The UK Top 40 is broadcast on BBC Radio 1, the Top 100 is published exclusively on OfficialCharts.com. View the biggest songs of 2024 so far.

drupalComments.title: e869d837-a914-4c7b-b2ba-c2dab6f285b4
drupalComments.body: 31st December 2015... and the train has halted there. Thank you all for joining me through this fun, fun, REALLY fun year, and I’ll see you back on the new article. I appreciate you all. :)

drupalComments.title: b0fe78db-e508-4ede-9e9e-b93cd7e387e0
drupalComments.body: It's the same Christmas songs that appear the charts every year in December. They should now release some brand new Christmas songs in 2016

drupalComments.title: ea29994c-87f9-423e-b20b-448510aa8c1a
drupalComments.body: Can someone tell why Kylie's Chris Martin-penned single "Every Day's Like Christmas" didn't chart?

drupalComments.title: 15e3fe6d-bdd8-463b-aa06-44421a758a32
drupalComments.body: Peak position info is so random! Shakin Stevens, Slade, Mud and Jona Lewie's chart history pre-2007 are shown correctly so why not Wizzard, John Lennon and Boney M? John & Yoko's Happy Xmas peaked at #2 on its original release, Boney M's Mary's Boy Child was #1 for 4 weeks in 1978, and Wizzard spent 4 weeks at #4 in 1973 (while Slade were #1). Get your facts right, guys, some of us are old enough to remember!

drupalComments.title: 15ef236c-871b-4b15-918f-8c07db0a5962
drupalComments.body: I wonder what the first number 1 song of 2016 is gonna be...

drupalComments.title: d6415c69-2998-4786-997e-572bafe4617c
drupalComments.body: I bet you the NHS song is going to drop to like 30 next week and X Factor will drop to like 80

children.title: c5272af3-b382-488c-8ece-ae2c5f02ed6b
children.body: Well yes for A Bridge Over You but Forever Young will probably drop fairly steadily, a bit at a time.

drupalComments.title: 81afe17f-2720-4ae6-9ca3-bef19af4f163
drupalComments.body: Nice to see some Christmas songs in the Top 40 but a shame that none of the new generation have made it. Compared to the 'FAB Chart' the official singles chart is a bit uninspiring.

drupalComments.body: To be honest, if it wasn't for Band Aid 20 Can We Fix It would probably be the best Christmas number 1 of the milennium so far. Not CHOIRS or X factor fails.

drupalComments.body: why there isnt holiday chart ?

drupalComments.title: 5b53f23e-ec8c-46e6-b36e-197a907bd873
drupalComments.body: FOLK the UK!!! Why does Billboard give that bigoted nation much credit or acknowledgement is beyond reason! Not Selena Gomez on the chart. Racist rats.

children.title: ee42f4ba-ab7e-4fd3-8330-200faa9ace9b
children.body: Yeah y SELENA Gomez not on here something sketchy going on.

drupalComments.title: d2acc813-7895-4127-9929-a3cb324dce42
drupalComments.body: first time that i m seeing so many xmas songs on the chart.poor kylie not even one entry from her new songs

drupalComments.title: c1ce54d6-b493-4626-bc62-397f8cc9f0de
drupalComments.body: All streaming is doing is making sure Justin Bieber stays as high up as possible. WDYM would only be at number 13 without streaming sales, rather than number 5

drupalComments.title: d7721b91-721d-45b5-a236-745faf7d9d41
drupalComments.body: More than a fifth of this chart is made up of old festive songs, which, by now, most of us are sick and tired of hearing everytime we walk into a shop to get something this month. I've even walked out of shops playing this , and every year the British public don't help the situation by downloading them to register sales into this chart. Next week, as all 21 drop out of the top 100 I expect even more rubbish will re-enter to take their places.

children.title: cae5b16a-ac18-4e8f-86a3-2fa872d7b001
children.body: Several of them have reached their highest position since 2007 this year. Some of that has to be the increased influence of streaming.

children.title: b8b90f93-7c0b-4734-b115-5a606e28d69a
children.body: There will be re-entries of several songs displaced by the Christmas records.

children.title: 371e5976-9703-4807-8dc6-166ad7a0778a
children.body: Clearly enough people are not sick of listening to them, as they are streaming them and that's why they're charting. Interesting how they go in and out of fashion- I haven't heard E, L & P once this year.

children.title: b46ad4c8-596b-47b8-bfd2-e0c62b40a466
children.body:
I'm on your side. These songs . I can't believe that people are still listening to the same, boring christmas songs. I mean, most of the people listen to the same music every year.
But on the other hand, comercial songs and artists like Justin Bieber or Taylor Swift are as terrible as "last christmas".
Sometimes I'm wondering where good music has gone.

children.title: 9c33aa71-ec2c-48ee-942c-c747ddf8b30a
children.body:
"Good music?"
If by that, you mean music you like, well, it hasn't gone anywhere. You can go buy an album with songs you like on it or stream music you do like on YouTube or Spotify or something. Music you like hasn't gone anywhere.
If there isn't any NEW music you like, which I guess is what you're calling "good music," simply don't listen to it or buy it. Simple.

drupalComments.title: 55ed96ae-dca2-4226-b5f7-52dededb0c2a
drupalComments.body: The true chart fans will notice that Chris Rea's Driving Home For Christmas is currently at its highest ever position; it peaked at #33 on its original release, and it's currently at #29.

children.title: 9f8c4535-f11d-40a1-ba4c-ccc53a0fe084
children.body: In fact, on its original (vinyl) release, in late 1988, as the lead track on The Christmas EP, it only made #53. It's come a long way since then...

children.title: ae152318-52cb-4aba-bffc-52ab72fde82c
children.body: That is super! It is such a great song!!!

children.title: d2b4e84b-0e36-4f69-84b0-cb73e7604916
children.body: It probably sold more copies on it's first release. Not many singles are bought these days, so it's not as big a deal to make the top 30 today.
